Suppose a fourth-degree polynomial equation is given by f(x) = 2x^4 - 5x^3 + 6x^2 - 8x + 4. 

(a) Graph this polynomial equation on the Cartesian plane accurately. 
(b) Find the local and absolute minimum and maximum values of the equation. 
(c) Determine the roots of the equation and classify each root as a single root or multiple root, and as a real or complex root.

Since the function is a fourth-degree polynomial, it has no absolute maximum or minimum, as the tails of the graph extend to positive and negative infinity.
